entry.name: SNAILS_ACT3_MEET_PT2
entry.page: You seem displeased, Old One. We only did as you asked, yes? The snare is sprung, the creature consumed.You bound it to that void!Don’t play daft. You should well know our family’s fixations. Surely you had a hunch?How else could we hope to trap one of your pale kin? Or see her consumed with such insatiable efficiency?Then you have miscalculated, gravely. The white knight, she fell with the mother...Oh ho... The quakes, yes? We have felt their force, even here. So the mother resists the dark... to save the child?That is my guess. I must descend to the void below, and see clear that truth for myself.Ohhhh. How… unfortunate. All of Pharloom will fall to her flailing.So it may, but I will not watch idle while it crumbles.

entries.entry: This lump here is well heavy, and shiny too, so it’s surely worth somethin’!
Desperate times make for desperate customers, heh heh! So let’s get to tradin’, eh?

Again... Huu... Huu. Truly incredible!Was it the course? Did I lose focus? Or are you simply the bug I have waited so long for? Her of such skill that my wish could, at last, be granted?Another reward must be given for your speed, nimble bug. One deserved in full!

Have you heard, miss grown-up? Beyond the moss, in the crumbled caverns filled with worms, much change is happening, different to the horrid, stretching dark outside.What brings such bright and bold transformation? Is it a beast? Or a bug unseen? How wondrous it would be to discover them, hidden away in some deep corner!You must go searching, miss grown-up! You and that sharp, sharp blade. Think of the strange and succulent shell waiting to be added to your journal?

Now, isn’t this a wondrous place! Golden bells, for weary shells! Ha ha ha!This settlement offers safety now, little pilgrim. Perhaps you should make a home here?You’ve done well to make it this far, and the roads ahead will only be more dangerous.Oh, dangerous they surely are! But I will gladly tread any path that holds wonders as magnificent as this, red maiden!

entry.name: MAPPER_MEET_BONE_1C
entry.hpage: You have keen sight for my skill, bug, but my childhood has long since passed. What has happened here? I see signs of battle all around.

entry.name: MAPPER_WHITE_FLOWER_ACT3
entry.hpage: The time is close, Shakra. The cost was grave, and the challenge steep, but I have claimed a power that can put end to this disaster. Gendaa... This is good, Hornet Wielding Needle, essential. My own strength has near reached its limit, and the dark husks continue their assault unceasing.Take your final action, and let us all see the end of this.

entries.entry: Your achievements in the games are inspiring! In time, I may have to challenge those impressive scores...

entry.name: GARMOND_REPEAT
entry.hpage: Good luck on your quest Garmond. If you hope to claim justice for your fellows passed, I suspect you’ve some challenge yet ahead.Aye! Zaza and I’ll fight to cavern’s end if it need be, for the bugs held in our hearts, and our honour as knights!

entries.entry: Ahh, can you feel it too? The thralls of the Citadel are gathered close, in overwhelming numbers!Together though, the three of us would be more overwhelming still! Would you allow us to fight by your side, brave sister?

Well, well! See what happens to nasty bully-bugs when they come after poor old Grindle? That’s a well-deserved end, we reckon.We heard this old Sitty-dell was nice and quiet and burstin’ with goodies. So what’s happened, eh? Why’s it crawlin’ with bullies and busybodies?The creature that haunts this place is stirring, little thief. The Citadel’s caste now roam the halls. You would do well to leave soon, if you mean to survive.What what? You bein’ mirthful? We’re stayin’ here ‘til we’re done pilfering! You should be the one leavin’ if you’re so afeared!

High up, above the caverns all of crust, Nuu has been told of a hole, filled with writhing things, all zipping and zapping.But so sad! Nuu cannot herself see it. The lands quake and rattle. The savage threads stretch. The dangers are too much.It must be you, miss grown-up, older, stiffer, a shell less precious. Seek the cave, and the things within. How else will the journal be complete?

Ahh miss grown-up, Nuu hoped you would return here. For clever Nuu can track well where you have been, she sees your cut-marks and sniffs out your fragrant trail!And look where the trail has led sweet Nuu! A thick wriggler lived in this nest, rumbling and crackling in the darkness.Its sour juices still line these rocky insides, and patient Nuu will gather it all up!There is much to learn in these crusted highlands Nuu, but much danger as well. Indulge your curiosity if you must, but keep your senses trained on the darkness.
Don’t let defeat weigh on you, nimble bug! If strength remains, simply step again to the challenge. Let us soar swift together!

Oh! Those horrible beasty-beasts are gone! Much and many thanks for you, mighty warrior!It was a simple thing, small bug. I assume you are Tipp, the courier?Frey, the Bellhart trader, seemed concerned for your safety... and for the cargo you carry.She sent you?! Bah! She needs to learny-learn a little patience! I’m is barely been away! But still... is lucky-lucky for me you came.
Sands of Karak Map
Well, I’m is be off now. That old grubly-grub in the bell will come after me herself if she not get her goods!
Now I must train, and strive, further and faster by your example. Your skill upon these tracks has roused my spirit, nimble bug. You shall forever have my thanks.
A town built within the thick vein of bells that runs through Pharloom’s core. One wonders who would craft so many, and for what purpose?

Hornet Wielding Needle! With my master’s passing, I have resolved to improve my skills that, in time, I may match her prime.Much work I must do to achieve that goal. I have found this wide bare stone fine ground on which to train.Would you spar with me now? Raise that blade and test my rings! You may prove my greatest challenge yet.

entry.name: MAPPER_MAPPING
entry.hpage: Your charts and tools show fine skill, Shakra. I’ve met few who’d match your talent.Cartography! Peh. Bakallo! It is a craft-skill common amongst my tribe. Most important to keep one’s mind sharp when on a journey.The charting of caverns, the memory of travel, the knowing of one’s place within the kingdom, an engaging task for a warrior’s mind.An unfortunate thing that my great mentor never learnt the skill. Her talent at getting lost... I should almost be impressed...

entries.entry: Lots of good stuff tucked away in this old prison... lovely place to bring a lucky little snitchbug like Grindle! What a favour those lugs did us! O-hoho!
Oooh, ma. Miss grown-up, you deny poor Nuu? So sour!I am sorry, Nuu. Though I recognise the value in your wish, my own task is too pressing.
Come to rest here, miss grown-up? Then let Nuu see our journal, for she is eager to see your cuts!

This great structure... It would have taken the lifetimes of so many bugs to build it. Now its wounds run deep, and I can hear the groaning of its final breaths.Everything that grows must pass, I suppose. Still, to witness even its current state is a privilege I’ll not squander.And what of you, friend Hornet? Where are your travels taking you?They have taken me deep, and will take me yet deeper still. I have a responsibility to cut this land free of its dark fate.That is no concern of yours though, sir. You should continue your own journey, albeit with a claw on your weapon at all times.

To our safe haven? Our home... This is what’s left of it after the great breaking began.There was that terrible noise from above. Everything shook and fell apart, and the black threads sprung up from beneath. Many a poor pilgrim has already been lost to the destruction.You might have been too, if not for some fleeing pilgrims who found you fallen and carried you back to us.The black threads... I may understand their source.I must speak with the old Caretaker. Do you know what has become of him? I see he has left you his garb.Oh, yes. He charged me with looking after those remaining here, said he had to confer with his family down below.Down below... Then they have slunk away to hide in their ruined chapel.I must pay them a visit. Thank you, Sherma. Stay safe, and take care of your fellow pilgrims.
Bakkana! A battle well won! The haunted bugs have been defeated and the way forward is yours. Let us meet again soon, away from this dreadful Citadel.
Huge caves ascending to Pharloom’s Citadel. The roads are slowly being devoured by sand and howling wind.

entry.name: G_PRINCE_SONG_REPEAT
entry.hpage: Farewell, tall bug, until we cross again.Or until death calmly claims us both...

entries.entry: Again and again you prove your mastery, nimble bug, yet still I never tire of the challenge!As reward for such an impressive feat of endurance, I have only this small trophy, a memento given by my own speed teacher, now fairly passed to you.

entry.name: SNAILS_ACT3_DEEP_MEMORY_REPEAT
entry.page: Bring us the hearts, Old One. Make’em beat, fierce and final. See for yourself the forgotten strength of this land of bugs before we burn those memories in its saving.

entries.entry: Tch... Hahahaa. Marvelous! So the spider knows something of fathomless beings, and still it hopes to stand against one, a god... Where do you hide this boundless strength you claim, spider? I’ve watched your struggle towards us. Yours was a painful, broken trek. One needs grace to stand before the divine.Then best you keep watching, child. I’ve found those who claim themselves a god can rarely match the title.And experience tells me, even gods can fall.

entry.name: MAPPER_GENERIC_WILDS
entry.hpage: Shakra, you look well at home in these wilds.Poshanka! These scorched fields offer many paths and much combat. To leap from vantage upon the red-shells or to meet them face-front with rings ready? These are decisions to live for!I am much surprised those soft pilgrims ever safely climbed this scorched and savage place.

entries.entry: Here, the proof of our majesty... mark of our divine right...

Hoi hoi! A nimble opponent appears. At last! At last!If you are seeking challengers, sir, you should choose a location less far afield. It is rare chance I, or any bug, would come upon this distant cavern.True! Though once discovered, could there be a more perfect spot? This giant, boney body, so distant from Pharloom’s ails.Here, freely, we can test our speed and our sleek shells. Here we may race!You must be eager to step to the task, challenger? Fulfil my wish! Let us discover our limits together!
Our capital, built grand... The seat of our sovereignty... slipped from my mind...Why does it fade? Why can I not recall that sacred place?
Zaza and I will tarry here a little longer... These pilgrims need watching over, and we are committed to the task.

Delicious! I like you already!But what a bore it would be to cut you down now, when you’re so achingly close to our grand Citadel...Climb higher, little spider. I want to savour your struggle just a little longer!
But Nuu is sensible, she understands. Miss grown-up has purpose, she must be away.The cleaning can wait for another time. Nuu is patient... always patient.

entry.name: GRINDLE_SLAB_2
entry.hpage: You seem to have some familiarity with this prison and its guards. Do you know a path to escape?Escape! A little jailbug like you ain’t ever escapin’ anything! Get out of here, will you? Stop bothering us! You got nothing to steal, so we got nothing to talk about!

entries.entry: Though the dust has not yet settled over our battle here, Zaza and I must soon be away. The memory of our village calls us ever onward. Farewell, brave sister!

entry.name: SPRINTMASTER_OFFER_4
entry.page: You would challenge again, nimble bug? You have proven yourself time and again.Your course can still provide understanding, sir. Upon it, I see my own limits clearer and learn to push them further. Of course! Of course! And I can learn much following behind your fair form.I’d need only a moment, and the track would again be ready.

entry.name: LACE_MEET_3
entry.hpage: Your threats are worthless, child. If you are my foe, stay your voice and raise your blade.

entries.entry: I can save you, little spider. All the trouble you’d face above. All the suffering. It’s so simple.I’ll just skewer you here and now, pluck that flickering life right out of you.
How sad. A little spider has fallen from its cage. So lost. So weak. Poor little morsel.
Ooooh ma, is well-begun. Many creatures have been recorded, but many many more still to be learned of!Miss grown-up, you should rest quick and venture out to hunt again soon, thinks Nuu!

Well fought sister, well fought! Though terrible and tenacious, the beast was no match for us.Be proud! The bugs of this land will sing of our victory to their offspring, and their offspring’s offspring, forever more!

Hah... aha ha ha ha ha!Congratulations, spider. Finally, I felt your sting, and you’ve bared the truth of my pathetic empty shell.You always had the scent, child. You are no bug. Yours is a life born entirely from thread.Life? You’re too generous! This weak, wasting existence. This was not life, just a husk shaped to act as a child.Yours was life, pale one. Do not confuse your unique creation with its absence. I have seen others make the same mistake.Platitudes, spider? From you? Don’t be gross.Head on. Climb up, up and away. You’ve earned your audience with the divine.Face the holy mother who would fashion so cruel and crude a daughter as me.
Conversing is a pleasure, but I must return to my observance. Try not to leave too much of a trail when you leave, please.

entry.name: SNAILS_ACT3_DESCEND_REPEAT
entry.page: Enough chatting, Old One. Best you get heading below. Whatever action you’re planning, time is against you.

entries.entry: For sharing this moment I shall have you accept a gift, one I had believed I would never pass. You would take these rings, and the learnings to make more.They are built of a clever method devised by my master and will crush hard this kingdom’s toughest shell. Use them, and she is remembered!My thanks, Shakra. To gain a tool so defined by its owner, I am much grateful. They shall prove a great aid on my own journey.
The warmth of these caverns keeps many smells alive! Is good for Nuu, who is always searching carefully for learnings!

entry.name: SHERMA_CITADEL_SPA_NOENCLAVE
entry.hpage: Little pilgrim, these baths provide some respite from the dangers without, but even so you should not let down your guard.You must have seen now that the bugs of this Citadel are long fallen to the Haunting.Ahh... some of my brothers and sisters have seemed... lost somehow, yes. But to be lost is to be sometime found, is it not sung?Yes... The Citadel will provide for them. It is a holy place indeed, that holds wonders such as this lovely warm bath!

entries.entry: Hoi! Let our mighty contest of shells commence again!

Hoy! We thought one of them buzzing bullies was sneakin’ up on us, but it’s just a mangy jailbug!Why you in here, then? Caught thievin’ were you? Greedy, greedy!I’ve stolen nothing. Rather, I suspect the wardens are servants of the Citadel. The cage used in my capture bore similar runes to the one that first brought me to this land.Bound in that cage, I’d have proved a fine gift were they to deliver me to their masters.Pah, there ain’t nothin’ fine about you, jailbug. We recognised a fellow thief soon as we saw you!Now, don’t be lingerin’ around here. Those guards’ll be wanting to pop you back in your cage quick quick!They’ll not get the chance. I will reclaim my belongings and leave this grim place with haste.
You recover quickly. Already, my ring-marks have faded from your shell. If you are prepared, let us duel again.

...Yes, communication is the heart of it. The grandest boasts and the tiniest murmurings all have their meanings......Your point is well made. Even the flowers have their stories to tell. Light can be cast anywhere...I’ve no desire to interrupt your meditations, Herald, but I am eager to speak with you, if you would listen......Take note of it all, render it in line, you’ll be glad that you did. You can take the journey home with you...
Oooh, but the scroll is so heavy with beautiful beasts! Could it be that the works is almost complete? Miss grown-up, you must keep your preyings up. No time for rest!
The myth we made... by grace... by blade...All bowed before we princes green...
So many moments spent simple... joyful... free...

Do you see? How crass and frail that Citadel’s machines! This one groans in pain at its very existence.Its mechanism is likely jammed. If the gears were unstuck its clamorous complaints would soon cease, and it could become a useful place to rest.A place to rest or no, I desire only for the noise to stop!

These root-woven roads show evidence of my master’s passage. A thrice-crushed bug, gouged wood, score-prints of sharp claws passing. Small signs that only I can read.Though the trail is cold, it eases me to know she is still within this land.

entry.name: GILLY_INTRODUCE
entry.hpage: These are dangerous fields, young one, not for casual wandering. What task sees you brave them?A treacherous quest! But a crucial one! Upon the last wish of my father, I’ve taken up the study of these wild caves.These fields still display life and growth, even as the lands around erode to dust.There is a hot harmony here that eludes the grey wastes above and the dry Marrow beside. With time and study, I shall uncover why.

entries.entry: Track your location throughout these winding lands with a bone compass. Each member of our tribe can craft them. I would pass you mine, for a small price.
Ooooh, ma ma! Even young Nuu never guessed that Pharloom held so many fascinating creatures! Soft ones, hard ones, small ones, big ones! Nuu is greedy to see what remains!

You see this idol before us, red maiden? I have passed its like before. They mark our pilgrimage well.If we sing to it, a miraculous shrine will rise from the ground, and we will have a place to rest! Such a wonder!It is not song that rouses this shrine, but payment in rosaries.Without rosaries, the shrine remains hidden. I have encountered similar constructs on Pharloom’s paths. This kingdom does not grant rest lightly.

You can use these to mark places of importance or reminders on your map.
These I have fashioned from the husks of old bells. A hard task to make, so the cost reflects the extra effort.

Poshanka! Here we meet, high atop this twisted steel structure. I can sense fierce enemies ahead.It seems you too draw closer to your trail’s end. With my own task now resolved, my rings call for combat.Hornet Wielding Needle, shall we fight forward together?
All of these marvellous healing supplies... Surely they, at least, are some proof of the Citadel’s holy nature?
H-hoy red m-maiden! Have no f-fear, ‘tis only I, Sherma!I found healing supplies, b-but then the way back collapsed... and I heard moaning from the dark... oh, how thankful I am to see you!
Wormways Map
Shall we fight forward together?
The great Citadel is so close, I can hear the voices of our brother and sister pilgrims calling out to us!

What a battle, brave warrior! You’re the first I’ve seen who could match the red-shells and emerge victorious.They are deadly foes indeed, and seemingly keen hunters. You did well to keep yourself hidden from them, young bug.I did, didn’t I? Disguise and subterfuge are skills I’ve honed keenly, all in aid of my most important work!

Mind yourself while you travel this grim land. A great winged beast has been stalking the heights, swooping without warning and tearing the life out of unwary travellers!I believe I have seen the creature you speak of. It may have marked me as prey, and followed me down onto the lower roads of the moor.What what! Gurrrooo! The beast has been spotted! Once Zaza has fully rested, we’ll set to tracking it down!

Welcome back red maiden, and thank you again for coming to my aid.I’m no healer, but with the supplies we found in the ward below even my unlearned claws can ease the suffering of our brothers and sisters.That such darkness could creep into this most holy of places, even though we pilgrims kept our promise to ascend...I confess, I wonder at the meaning of it all. But enlightenment does not come easily, or all at once... I should just continue my task in the meantime.

Hrm...? Oh, hoy there! I was hoping we would meet here, red maiden.Rising at last to the heights of the Citadel and being amongst so many of my brothers and sisters... it is a blessing indeed. Yes, a blessing.Your voice belies some hesitation in that belief, little pilgrim. You have seen now the reality of this broken place. What do you make of it, truly?

Safely-saved is Pill! But who is this rare carer for the shell of another? Name yourself, good bug!I am Hornet, Pill. Your brother wished for your return to Bellhart, where he waits now. I’m sure he will be eager to see you alive.Young Tipp! How he worries always. Blessed I am for the care, him and you Miss Hornet! A lucky bug is me!
I pray my dice bring you luck on your final climb, sister. And I pray that by parting with them, my own ascent shall be made lighter.

See here, this old statue. I’ve been thinking long on it, what clues it might hold.The claw-work seems beyond the other structures throughout these caves. Who was she I wonder, to deserve such refined remembrance?Hers is the form of a dancer, and the craft is indeed exquisite. There must once have been more to these ants, before the Haunting snared their shells and minds.
Uahhhhh... The forbidden taste...

Holy water, nice and hot,
Makes a perfect swimming spot,
Heals your worries in a flash,
So jump on in... splash splash splash! Ha ha ha!
Very, very lucky little trinket we got ‘ere! Pulls ‘em little clickie-clackies right into yer waitin’ claws!

Gurrroo! A fellow warrior braves this blighted place! Know you stand before the honoured knight Garmond, and brave companion Zaza.Together, Zaza and I are wish bound to scale this Citadel, and vanquish the horrors at its heart!Then good luck to you, sir bug. It is heartening to meet another of sound mind and fortitude enough to fight back against the many haunted husks.Aye! Never-ending, these unnatural opponents! This Citadel seems its twisted source, and honour decrees we must fight on, until we rend the heart of its decay!

entry.name: SNAILS_ACT3_SHAMAN_CREST
entry.hpage: I found the well in the hidden chambers beyond. The power that remained at its base I have taken for myself.Bound yourself a new nature, aye? And from the shells of our ancestors, no less, all those many who’ve called these lands their own.You make it seem so simple-like. All o’that learning, all o’that strength... sucked up in a whirl of Silk.We’d call you a thief, Old One, and cruel for the taking, but it’s all coming down soon if you can’t stop it.If there’s advantage in your act that might see these caves safe, then it’s better you make your claim.

entries.entry: Best keep your visits brief, Hornet Wielding Needle. Without swift action taken, our world’s ruin seems certain.If you cannot calm Pharloom’s tortured throes, then certainly no other bug could face the task. As you say, Shakra. I shall do what I must.

Near the edge of those lands swept by wind and sand, Nuu has seen it, a single bug, watching, waiting. Too scared was Nuu to crawl close, for fear it would wake, and its big blade might mark this perfect shell.For the journal’s sake, you should seek the bug, up on edge, through a tall tunnel hidden by crust.A hard find, that one, but Nuu is not worried! She knows your adult cunning will see you there quick!

For my mapping stock, we have traded all the charts and tools I can provide. While this new threat remains, I shall not make more.My cartography may be a simple sort, but I hope that my craft shared has made your travels easier.
Lead on, sister! Zaza and I will be close behind!
Hoy! Did you see it, red maiden? The great gate heard my song and, in its infinite and ancient kindness, has opened the way forward for us!

entry.name: GARMOND_CITADEL_DEFEATED_REPEAT
entry.hpage: Must you not press on, sirs?Oh, yes! We will be off at once. Very soon. I fear though, that Zaza must rest a little longer...

entries.entry: Poshanka! Edges sharp and senses keen!

entry.name: SNAILS_ACT3_TALK2
entry.page: Even knowing her motivation, it is a shock the monarch can resist so long. We’d thought none could survive that void.She will have retreated within her protective form, that cocoon of thread. Even as the dark eats its outer, she will spin its Silk anew.The effort would be immense and it will strain her soul thin, but what other choice remains?This is the desperate act of a dying god. A defiance that, left unchallenged, will bring your kingdom’s ruin.

entry.name: SNAILS_ACT3_TALK1
entry.page: The quakes... This collapse will take Pharloom all.If the void doesn’t claim it first. Surely you’ve seen them, the black threads that wrack your lands? The dark leeches up, possessed upon the fallen monarch’s Silk.Pharloom’s roads were not safe before. Now they’ll prove impassable. Those pilgrims still alive in your lands best huddle and hope. If there can be another end to this, it is up to us to discover it.

entry.name: SHERMA_BONEGATE_MEET_2
entry.hpage: Why do you sing, little one? This bony gate seems like a poor audience.

entry.name: SHERMA_RESCUE_END2
entry.hpage: Can you safely make your way back to the settlement, little one? I could escort you if need be.Oh no, I’ll lay no more of my troubles upon you, red maiden. With the way cleared I can return under my own guidance.After all, what’s another pilgrimage, eh? Ha ha!Oh! And I have something for you as well. I found it buried amongst the broken relics down here in the darkness, glowing with a pale light.’Tis an odd-looking thing... not exactly holy-seeming... but I would be honoured if you accepted it all the same!

entries.entry: The challenge! The course! It shall be improved. Yes! Yes! The truest test is still to come. We shall fly fast together once more!
I’ve learnt too that travelling is not without its dangers... but I find myself wielding my weapon quite adeptly.It’s curious, the way our instincts can guide us with such precision.
Bellhart Map
Un-Daak... well struck. To face the fury of your weapon in a true battle would be an experience indeed. I would gladly duel again, if you have the time for it.
Hoho sister, my whiskers are still quivering! That’s how you know you had a rousing battle!You go on ahead. Zaza and I will keep guard here and catch any stragglers.
Hoy, red maiden. ‘Tis a prayer answered to see you safely wake.Little Sherma? What has happened here?

Poshanka! So you found my calling ring, Child Wielding Needle. I recognised the sound of your weapon’s foreign metal against it.On the hunt for my master, I am often away, but I still use this place as camp. Use the ring to call me whenever you wish to make trade.
Far Fields Map

entry.name: SHAKRA_AID_ACCEPT
entry.hpage: Gladly I will accept your aid Shakra. Let us cut closer to this Citadel’s haunted heart.Garrok! Hornet Wielding Needle. Beside you, I will gladly raise my rings!

entries.entry: I’d hoped to never step these hateful halls, yet here I stand, as all those hapless bugs before.You’ve journeyed far from that damp cell, tall bug. If you would oppose the minions of this Citadel, you have my respect.Hmph. Then we share a rare stance, warrior. Few others seem possessed of will enough to resist.So many weak minds, drawn up and strung, in love with the great golden leech atop their lands.

Ho there, brave sister! What poetry has fate writ, that we should meet here at the peak of this ghastly Citadel!Beasts and fiends, all here are lost to that horrid Haunting! And out from this golden corpse it seeps to plague the good bugs of the land below. Well, no more we say!You should beware brave sirs, the creature that commands this curse is a foe far beyond bug. I would not see your lives given in vain.Pah! We beware nothing! We would give our lives a hundred times over to finally cut away the evil that clutches our kingdom!

Goodness! This is just too embarrassing! Detected even through my perfect cover! What tell? What error? Surely something gave me away!It was no one thing, young bug. Your disguise is near faultless. I’ve merely spent a long life being watchful.Gah! Then I’ll just have to hope the beasts about don’t share such keen sight. It’ll be so much harder to accomplish my work if I’m detected, or eaten!

entry.name: GARMOND_AID_ACCEPT
entry.hpage: The battle ahead may indeed be arduous. I accept your offer of aid, sirs.Gurrrro! Yes! No force in the kingdom can withstand our might! Lead on, sister! Zaza and I will be close behind!

entries.entry:
Sister, sister, tired and glum,
We will sing, and you can hum,
Together we shall overcome!

entry.name: SNAILS_ACT3_DEEP_MEMORY1
entry.page: Oh ho! Back from the depths with nary a scratch! Is it as you feared?It is, and worse. Your snare has sunk the monarch deep, deeper than I can safely descend.To cut Pharloom free, I must plunge below the surface of that lake of liquid nothing. No shell survives submersion in that void, Old One, not even yours.Not without aid, certainly. Though aid may exist. The flower that resists the dark. Do you know of it?The Everbloom?... We’ve heard the tale, but had thought it a myth. If ever it sprouted in our lands we would surely have known?I would not seek it in these lands. I need its power full, and it is too fragile to sustain here long. I would seek it in my memory. Oh ho ho! So you’d have us wrench open your soul, to retrieve the fabled bloom? Can such a thing be done?For another bug, no, but I am Weaver enough to attempt it.In the distant past, I knew the flower. My thread still holds its faint memory. If the Everbloom was grasped strongly enough within my Silk, it could be made to manifest.Ah! So you’re asking another spell of us? To reveal the flower clear?... But to illuminate one of your kind’s old memories, so acutely... This is no easy thing, even for us...Old One, you must give us a moment to confer...

entries.entry: Hunter’s March Map
My wish is granted... and now everything I love is lost...

Gara Takana! What has happened to you, Child Wielding Needle, to cause you such brutal weakening?You are seeing the effects of a parasite, Shakra, a writhing entity implanted by force. It will not kill me, not quickly at least, but its presence wears greatly on my shell.It is a horrid state you suffer. Fight yourself free, or find help with haste. I would not wish to see you defeated by such deceitful strength.
Hoi! Let our mighty contest of shells commence again!
You’re in the habit of craftin’ all kinds’a nasty tools’n traps, aint’cha? This kit’ll let you build ‘em even nastier, heh heh...

Poshanka, Child Wielding Needle. This heart-home is cut free of its curse.Tell me, was it your blade that brought its saving? My shock would be great if another here managed the feat.I slew a tall creature above the town, a Weaver I suspect, though one twisted in purpose.By voice and claw it aided, perhaps guided, the thread that strung the town. Weaver? Those vicious old things! To our young we tell the tales, but had thought them long dead, only corpses bound in spires. This one still lived, though if it was a Weaver, it was broken in a savage way.Its own Silk was bound, pinned deep within its shell. A cruel punishment I’ve not before witnessed. Even broken, my envy remains. A Weaver’s fabled skills... To meet one in combat means great challenge, and great pride in victory.

entry.name: MAPPER_GENERIC_GREYMOOR
entry.hpage: Fair greetings, Shakra. You are a welcome sight amidst the sodden gloom of these caverns. Child Wielding Needle, your aspect is still sharp. My respect remains. Heed a warning, many fierce bugs roost nearby.On the lake beyond this cave nest a ragged horde atop an old watermound. Their mastery of flight makes them dangerous. My shell will forever carry the score of their pins.If you’re seeking a safer path, head back, towards this land’s core.

entries.entry: Nuu is a long way from her safe lodging... perhaps she will stay in this nice, dark little squeezy place a little longer.

entry.name: SHERMA_CARETAKER_DELIVERY
entry.hpage: Sherma, I bring supplies from the town of bells below. Since you are now caretaker here, I entrust them to you.Oh, what a blessing! This will surely raise the hopes of our poor brothers and sisters.

entries.entry: Red maiden, you have some great task ahead of you, do you not? If so, then I fear the time of our final parting draws near.You sense it true, Sherma. I shall soon descend to the darkness below the kingdom and quell the source of Pharloom’s rending.If that task is achieved, my future may take me far from Pharloom, but know I have faith that you will hold these bugs together, and see them prosper.Ah! In truth, I’m still only a fool, but I’ll hold dearly to your faith in me. That warmth will help me to endure whatever challenges lie ahead!Now let me pray for you, dear friend, and may my hopes follow you into the deepest darkness and beyond!
Vendor Pins
The way forward is yours. Let us meet again soon.

entry.name: MAPPER_MEET_GUARD_ACT3
entry.hpage: Shakra, you pit yourself against the black-threaded bugs? They are dangerous foes, even for a hardened warrior.I relish such danger, and have little choice besides. These creatures besiege the town within. They are relentless, and empowered. ...It is the void, stretched up into this world and its husks. I know it well, this force, its nature. If it senses soul within, it will drive voracious towards it.As you say! Many bugs now huddle within the bells. Nowhere else is safe with this black threat rising.Some luck, at least, that I chose to remain, and can offer my rings’ defence.Shakra, I seek to end this new disaster, for in it I share much blame, but know, I shall need time to complete my task.I ask you hold fast till then. This town and its bugs need a guardian, and I can think of none better.Very well, Hornet Wielding Needle. A pact made strong. If you are working towards the venom’s end, I shall fight with faith renewed.

entries.entry: Let us charge on. My rings shall sing loud on the shells of our enemies.

And now, miss grown-up, the task is done! Nuu must be away.But do not be sour! Just think! Pharloom is only one land. So many more must hide out there, filled full with beasts and scents and tastes, all waiting to be discovered.For Nuu, her journey is only at its start. And for you, miss grown-up, Nuu wishes too your happy hunting, much and more!

entry.name: MAPPER_MEET_BELLHART_ACT3
entry.hpage: Shakra, what has happened here? For these masses to huddle so amongst such destruction?The dark-spun bugs, they besiege the town, relentless. I have defended against each wave anew, but they are empowered in foul ways, and I am much fatigued....It is the void, stretched up into this world and its husks. I know it well, that force, its nature. If it senses soul, it will drive voracious towards it.As you say! All these bugs, gathered close within the bells... but nowhere else is safe with this black threat rising.Shakra, I seek to end this new disaster, for in it I share much blame, but know, I shall need time to complete my task. I would ask you hold fast till then.This town and its bugs needs a guardian, and I can think of none better.Very well, Hornet Wielding Needle. A pact made strong. If you are working towards the venom’s end, I shall fight with faith renewed.

entries.entry: Eugh. Is it gettin’ hotter down here? Mustier? Grindle’s been down here too long. Reckon it’s time to climb back up soon, to where all the serious treasures is!
Dark Marker

So this is... defeat? Can it be? Huu... A shell so fast! Wonder of Pharloom! A bug whose pace could match my own.Though I set a simple course, you have proven its match and more. Take this small reward, nimble bug, and remember well our grand contest!
Oh, hoy there! Why, I must have dropped off to sleep as soon as I arrived!Certainly, the pilgrim’s way is exhausting, but a good rest is a reward unto itself!

That was a battle well-fought, Child Wielding Needle. Your master would be proud of you.The one who trained me long ago... I never called her master. Whether she would be proud of what has become of me, I cannot say.Nu-Hakkata! Whether she is dead or alive, have faith! Nothing a pupil does escapes their master’s sight!
Wide, dim hollows, choked by rag and dust. The bugs who once tended these lands have clearly lost their way.

Red maiden! Dear sister! At last, our great pilgrimage is at its end!Our faith never wavered, and now here awaits our glorious reward, the shining Citadel! Where all sing as one!I will not tell you to turn back, for I know you will not, but I urge you at least to be cautious. Terrible things lurk within this Citadel, little pilgrim.Oh, sister! There is no need for caution, and no need for fear. Let us step forward under guidance of our faith!

This vein of gilded bells creates an effectively defended settlement. I can see it once gave a long time of peace to its bugs.And yet, look at their numbers now. Stricken by cursed thread. Only a few have survived.We must learn from them, Child Wielding Needle. Peace is a slow poison that would wither even the hardiest bug.

entry.name: MAPPER_GENERIC_BELLHART_TALK1
entry.hpage: Your camp here looks comfortably set, Shakra. Are you planning to stay a time?Perhaps, yes. This heart-home makes a fine base for now and later if needed.Still! I must take care not to rest overlong. My shell would soften and my senses dull.

entries.entry: Oh, hullo again! This time, I most certainly do recognise you! ‘Tis a pleasure to bump into you here, deep in this serene wood.Do you have a name, like I do? Would you share it with me?Certainly, sir. I am Hornet.I notice you gazing at the buds above us... are they familiar to you, perhaps?Hm? No, not at all. Very beautiful though! Perhaps I should gather some up before venturing on...

You can use these to mark places of importance or reminders on your map.
These markers I have modelled after the sheen of my own shell. Perhaps you will think of me when you use them.
There are signs that pilgrims once travelled even these crumbling paths, long ago. Now only the voracious worms nest here.
Hoi! Nimble bug! Surely you have reconsidered? Let us discover our limits together!
You have purchased the last of my mapping stock, for now. Stay alive on your journey, and when our paths next cross we may trade again.
Don’t be lingerin’ here too long! We got snitchin’ to do and we ain’t keen on company!
If you venture further and higher into these caverns, beware. The sickly air only grows thicker.

I’ll be off soon, once I’m good and rested. Beyond the wood lies the final climb, and then at last we shall reach the Citadel!Which of us will reach the Grand Gate first? If it’s me, I shall wait for you so we can enter together!
If you would fight alone, I will say nothing more.

entry.name: GARMOND_ENCLAVE
entry.hpage: Fair meeting again, sir knight. I see this bell has drawn you too towards its safety.Who would have guessed, sister! A safe corner, hidden so high atop Pharloom’s cursed crown!Our fair village may have fallen, but for these fellows... these scared few, our honour charges us to keep them safe. Our hornlance shall raise for them! After some rest, of course.Hold fast to your new charge, Garmond. See these bugs survive, and know I aim, in time near, to cut down this curse at its core.

entries.entry: Sinner’s Road Map

O-hoho! Into Grindle’s pockets they go! And for you, a secret to remember us by...Beneath here and further on, the burly bellheads have a big, hot, gleaming hive! Full of all sorts of tasty snitchables!But there’s this big gate they got down in its belly... shut tight, locked up. If you could wriggle through, you’d get your claws on all kindsa goodies!

You see this idol before us, red maiden? I have passed its like before, they mark our pilgrimage well.If we sing to it, a miraculous shrine will rise from the ground, and we will have a place to rest! Such a wonder!I suspect it is not song that rouses this shrine, but payment in rosaries.I have encountered similar constructs on Pharloom’s paths. It seems this kingdom does not grant rest lightly.

O-hoho! Into Grindle’s pockets they go! And for you, a secret to remember us by...There’s lots of pickings round here, right? Well, it’s all nothing compared to what they got hidden up, up above us. The great big Sitty-del they calls it!A golden place, groaning with goodies! Could never steal it all in a thousand snitch-bug lifetimes they reckon!Oh yes, that’s where ol’ Grindle is headin’. Don’t you dare follow us, though! We want it all for us-selves!

O-hoho! Into Grindle’s pockets they go! And for you, a secret to remember us by...You know where all them dreary raggedies are camping? Back near the ol’ chapel? Well, beyond that chapel is a dirty great grave!Not much in there but husks, right? But but! My sniffer tells me there’s something worth the trouble buried down at the bottom!

entry.name: SNAILS_ACT3_MEET_END_VISITED
entry.hpage: The groaning docks, beyond the caverns of bone. There I have seen a vessel able to pass below, a heavy bell built for descent.I need only gain access, and an operator to assist. I will investigate the docks, and uncover the means.You’d be the first in an age to dive so deep, Old One. That space below remains long unseen, even to our family. For those depths, I am more prepared than most. I will reach the base of this land, and know the truth of the new disaster we together have wrought.

entries.entry: Why does it fade? Why can I not recall that sacred place?

entry.name: LACE_ABYSS_LAKE_1
entry.hpage: Here you lie, monarch. Sunk so deep, yet still you cling to life. Would you let your lands be choked black... to protect just her?

entry.name: GARMOND_EXPLORING_ACT1_REPEAT
entry.hpage: Take care, Garmond. Whatever dangers these lands present, I’m sure what waits in that Citadel will be worse.Aye, sister! Until that Citadel is reached and justice is served, Zaza and I shall not fall.

entries.entry: Letting you live was my rebellion, spider. I’ve denied my mother your silken strength. I’ve won.She can thrash, and waste, and know her pathetic, broken child caused the mortal wound.Rejoice! And let it all come down.I will not. I have already stood the sentinel for one dying land. That role... I will never play again.While I live, and possess the strength to resist, this kingdom, and the bugs within it, shall not fall.

Hahahhaa! Spider. Spider. What a marvellous specimen you are! You fight and fight, heedless as the world crumbles around you.Pharloom and her bugs will be crushed to dust, and still you’ll be vainly swinging your blade....There may still be a way to prevent that fate. I will claim the hidden power, the bloom that repels the dark.Those snails share some fault in the snare, and their callous use of the void. They shall help me now to seek its counter.I will return, child, when I bear the strength to dive below, and cut this land finally free of your mother’s grasp.
After some tasty goodies? We never say no to a fair trade, heh heh! Take a look at what we’s got...
We could add a little pocket to yer tool pouch for you. You could pack even more goodies in there! All your shards’n sharp things!

entry.name: MAPPER_TUBE
entry.hpage: Shakra, if I may, I’d ask a small task of your carving talents.Within the halls of the Citadel, I encountered a means of travel new to me, a network of pipes traversed in vessels propelled by steam and air.That Citadel is a labyrinth, and pins to mark each station would prove useful to me.What you describe sounds as hideous and unnatural as anything in that place. Still, if it will aid you, I shall craft the pins.Seek me at a moment not long from now. The pins will be carved, and we may trade.

entries.entry: These overgrown caves offer little challenge to a skilled warrior. A place for reflection, perhaps.
Fear not, red maiden! This shrine will surely rise for us, we only need to patiently wish for it!

entry.name: SNAILS_ACT3_HEART_HINT_SHELLWOOD
entry.page: In the heights of the great wood, nestled deep in its roots, vines and branches, find the one who sowed the first seed.They’re the very essence of the place, the nub of it all. Ain’t really a bug, to be told, but a powerful presence nonetheless.We’d heard the Citadel once made grudging accord with that creature, sent their servants in reverence, even built a shrine up there somewhere. Maybe it’s worth you searching for it?

entries.entry: Old roads and passages overrun by roaches and their keepers. The ways are covered thick with filth.
In this moment, I have no more items to trade. Perhaps, if we meet again on the roads ahead, I shall have crafted new goods to sell.
You like this gleaming spinner I snitched from the big Sitty-dell? There’s a way to make it sing to you, or so they says!
The Marrow Map

You can use these to mark places of importance or reminders on your map.
This dark-shell material is cold to the touch, and more resilient than it looks.
Crumbling roads built upon the shells of ancient bugs. All of Pharloom rests upon these fragile foundations.
Crusted heights above those howling steps. Signs suggest great warriors once ruled this winding place, though the sand has eroded much of their mark.

entry.name: MAPPER_MENTOR_MEET
entry.hpage: To search these lands so thoroughly, Shakra... I wonder, who is it you hope to find?Okklu-Din... a perceptive question. I travel in search of my mentor, the greatest of my tribe. I have followed her trail throughout this kingdom, but have so far failed to catch her.She will have travelled much farther by now, but if I keep moving and stay vigilant, we shall reunite.

entries.entry: The stone structures of this place suggest clear waters once ran throughout.What fantasy that now seems! Even this swamp’s inhabitants seem spawned of its noxious nature.

But look here! As soon as our sacred journey begins, we are tested. This huge gate stands between us and the way forward.Only holy prayer and song will open the way! In this kingdom, even mighty bone is moved by music!

You win again! Never have I met a luckier pilgrim...You mistake, sir. It was skill that won me this game. One must be careful not to rely merely on luck.Hmph. Fairly said, sister.I must confess something though. Truth is, I already lost the last of my rosaries. I can’t pay our last wager.I do have something small for you, at least. These dice. They certainly seem to have taken a liking to you. Take them, in memory of our meeting.

entry.name: LACE_ABYSS_LAKE_DIVE_2
entry.page: Who are you hoping you’ll find down there, spider? An ailing child and a Silk starved beast? If so, I’m afraid we may sorely disappoint. What waits below is me no longer.

entries.entry: Hoy, you’re still hanging around then? Quiet in here. Good for hidin’ out.You gots the li’l clicky-clackies on you then, eh? The rolly-roundies? What the shops like to swap for?
Shell Marker

You... So, it is done... My wish granted before ever I arrived...The bronze pair that danced this chamber, it is clear, tall bug, how closely they mimicked your shell. Was it you who provided their inspiration?Not I, warrior. For this place, my heart holds only loathing...The dancers... they were the last free act of my partner... Always hopeful. Always naive.His whole he gave, in desperate trade to see our own caves left safe. His shell and soul became the mould.So long, I dared not visit... Even as our lands fell to thread and ruin... Instead I wasted, a coward caged, too weak to witness his grace bound in parody so cruel.Take some solace, tall bug. His soul is now free from that shell of iron, and the fate that befell your lands, this Citadel too has been claimed full by it.Aye... Slim consolation, warrior, now that everything I loved is lost...

entry.name: SNAILS_ACT3_CLOVER_HEART
entry.page: What’s this? That’s an unexpected heart you’re holding, Old One...We can guess to its source, though we’d believed it long gone from these lands. The heart of a graceful lord. In its taking I was able to witness his caves and kingdom as once they flourished.A stunning sight. Unique. All gone... Lost to the pale monarch... and the system to keep her caged.

entries.entry: A beat of rosaries is our wager. Once you find enough, I’d be happy to play.

Nimble bug, you return refreshed! And so perfectly timed, for I have a new challenge prepared.The course shall remain the same as last, but length, the laps, will greatly extend.You propose a test of endurance? I have undertaken many in my time.Excellent! Excellent! Though know, for this race, I can only provide slight reward for victory.What say you, nimble bug? Let us stride fast forth!

entry.name: MAPPER_SPAR_DECLINE
entry.hpage: Another time, Shakra. I am always eager to learn, but for now my tasks call me away. Bakelo! Answer to your tasks, then. My rings shall await your return.

entries.entry: Gurrroo! Fellow warrior, if you are wishing to lock blades, know you stand before the honoured knight Garmond, and brave companion Zaza. Together we will face bold to any challenge!I have no wish to fight you, sir bug. It is heartening to meet another on these roads of sound mind, and with fortitude enough to fight back against the haunted husks.Aye! Too many, these unnatural opponents! We did hope Pharloom’s vast expanse would still possess some place free of that tainted thread. Alas, so far we’ve encountered only violence and decay. We greatly fear the Haunting afflicts this kingdom all.

Poshanka! Edges sharp and senses keen!In my land, that is the way warriors greet each other. For though you are a child barely hatched, you are also a warrior. Your stance, your weapon, your movements all proclaim it so.I am a navigator amongst my tribe, and have been making maps of these lands. I can trade them with you, and supplies, if you wish.
Rest below while you can. In the lands beyond these bells, it is rare to see such safety.
Greymoor Map

entry.name: HUNTER_FAN_JOURNAL_REPEAT
entry.hpage: Child, if your wish is to gain learning of this land’s creatures, why not hunt them yourself?Ma? Nuu, herself to hunt? No, no! Is not Nuu’s nature to hunt, is hers to come later and learn. Such is the way of things!But you... a predator! Know it from your smells can clever Nuu! So Nuu asks you to cut and record, so we both may learn!

entry.name: SHERMA_CITADEL_SPA_ENCLAVE
entry.hpage: Little pilgrim, these baths provide some respite from the dangers without, but there is a still safer place high on the other side of the Citadel.A settlement has formed around the old shrine there. The bell housed within seems to provide some sanctuary from the dangers of the Haunting.Your brother and sister pilgrims who now huddle around it would be glad of your company, I am sure.Oh, how wonderful! Yes, I will make my way over there with haste... after I have bathed a little longer. I want to arrive fresh and clean to such a holy place!

entries.entry: You hold many charts, Child Wielding Needle. You should consider trading for a quill.With a quill in claw, your maps can be further extended from your own travels. Record enough and you may, in time, come to know this kingdom all.

Poshanka! Child Wielding Needle. You too have discovered this haven of bells.For a long time, I avoided this place for sense of something strange. Now arrived, I find it free, and its few remaining residents offering trade and welcome.I slew a tall creature above the town, a Weaver I suspect, though one twisted in purpose.It was her you may have sensed. A formidable force, even aged. By voice and claw she aided, perhaps guided, the haunted thread that grasps these lands. Weaver? Those vicious things. To our young we tell the tales, but had thought them long dead, only corpses bound in spires. This one still lived, though if it was a Weaver, it was broken in a savage way.Its own Silk was bound, pinned deep within its shell. A cruel punishment I’ve not before witnessed. Even broken, my envy remains. A Weaver’s fabled skills... To meet one in combat means great challenge, and great pride in victory.

This outpost that the shambling pilgrim-bugs have built for themselves... Dondakku!Where are the armaments? The watch-poles? Never have I seen such a poorly defended encampment!The pilgrims here seem to have no mind for war, Shakra. I suspect most depart for the Citadel soon after their arrival.Hmph. If they persist in their carelessness, they will find only death in these harsh lands.

What’s this? The little spider climbs so high, here to stand aquiver at our startling Citadel.Pale child, you return only to mock? Neither you nor your land have proven my match. This sleeping Citadel shall be no different.Spider, dear. Why must you remain so distressingly... optimistic? The power that waits above, you cannot conceive, her who would snuff that hope with barely a glance.Fool child. You still think me blind to the form of your liege? Having come this far?This land’s grandeur, the devotion of its bugs, and the curse that befalls them. The signs are clear.Your kingdom is in the thrall of a creature beyond bug, one of that higher caste.Whatever its desire for my Silk and my shell, it shall find I’m quite attached to both.

Aren’t those solemn judge-bugs nice? They do not speak or sing, but I sense great wisdom behind their gleaming gazes!Beware them, little one. Wise or not, their judgements are often followed by violence. Many of your fellow pilgrims have fallen to them on these great steps.Oh...? But even the fallen will sometimes stand again, and all pilgrimages will be completed, yes? That’s how I’ve heard it!
These twisting tunnels hide many worthy opponents, but many traps as well. Watch your footing closely.
As you requested, these pins will mark the travel stations within that hideous structure of steel and steam.

entry.name: COURIER_TALL_THANK_PT2
entry.hpage: Head fast for Bellhart, Pill. These lands are not for travelling without a sharp blade in claw.Aye! Yes! To Bellhart, and my brother, I shall fly quickly-quick. If you pass that way again, stop and give greeting!

entry.name: MAPPER_MENTOR
entry.hpage: Who are you calling for, Shakra? Your voice echoes through the caverns.I came deeper into Pharloom in search of my mentor, the greatest of my tribe. I could not keep pace though, and her trail grew cold.She will have travelled much farther by now, but if I keep moving and stay vigilant I will reunite with her.

entries.entry: We must never let our shells soften, or Pharloom’s sharp teeth will sink in quick.Would you duel with me, Hornet Wielding Needle? Together we shall sharpen one another’s skill.
I’ll wish you success in your grand task, miss, but forgive me my sadness for knowing the cruel cost...
Hurry it up, let us out quickly then! We got places to go, bugs to see, trinkets to pilfer!

Warrior... I heard your approach. Why do you come? Surely you’ve no desire to see these long collapsed caves?The way was open, sir. I merely followed the path through. Am I correct to guess you were once a resident of these borderlands?Aye... and glorious they were, in their time. Pharloom’s end approaches, but my caves, these caves, fell to fate long before. Of that fair land, I am the last... Now to remain till the end, and remember the splendour that was...
Miss grown-up, you have hunted long with little rest, thinks Nuu.Perhaps you are covered in too many juices, weighed down by beastly filth? Let sweet Nuu clean you, make you fresh!
Delicious! I like you already!

entry.name: SNAILS_ACT3_DEEP_MEMORY2
entry.page: We could do it. The spell can be cast, with enough power, enormous power, equal maybe to that monarch...I cannot grant you mine, if it even were enough. My strength is still needed to face her below. Where else do you propose we seek a source?From Pharloom! Ho ho ho! Remember, ours is a kingdom of wishes granted.Pharloom was not born of that monarch, Old One. Power existed in these lands even before she bound them beneath her.Grnk. Seek the old hearts of our kingdom and the last successors to bear their strength.They’re still out there, hidden away, much faded by the pale one’s long dominion. You must make them stir.We will teach you how, in the way befitting a Weaver, a sombre song to reach down into their memories and enliven them a final time.

entries.entry: Owoww, what a rotten turn! Keep your nasty junk to yourself, then!
O-hoho! Share some of your little clicky-clackies with us, help us fill our pockets. If you do, we’ll share a sneaky secret with you!

Miss grown-up, for your continued huntings you should climb up, up above here, above the tallest spinning towers!Hidden in the dark thickets are strange bugs who call up dancing flames. So pretty! So warm!But when Nuu tried to crawl near, the flames became angry and swooped all around! Poor Nuu was half roasted!Nuu leaves it to you, miss grown-up, to climb up there and cut those flames apart. For our journal, such must be done.

Poshanka! Child Wielding Needle, have you seen trace of my master nearby? I feel she was here only recently!I cannot say for certain, Shakra, though if she travels seeking skilled opponents, these steps would serve her well. The warriors watching over them are formidable.True! Impressive guardians they are, fighting defensively and loath to leave their stations. They swing their weapons with a cold brutality that should not be underestimated.

Poshanka, Hornet Wielding Needle. For that is your name, is it not? I have heard it spoken in this land with reverence.I had hoped you would accept my summons. In these moments one is good, but two is best.I would not deny the wish, Shakra. A sombre ceremony seemed likely at this trail’s end, and I am sadly proved correct. This then is your master?The fiercest of my tribe, here she lies. I called her master, true, but she was mother just as much, more by far than the bug who bore me.Among the many marvels of this kingdom, she found a fine place to meet her end.Ended by age... My tribe would call that shame, but I see only strength unbeaten.Even as her shell betrayed her, she walked this kingdom’s breadth. It was her trail followed that allowed me to share witness to its dignity.Hornet Wielding Needle, you too have journeyed these many paths, as my master before us. Join me now for her song-sending.It is time for her soul to walk beyond her shell...
From this safe vantage, I can keep watch for threats while I work. These lowlands are brittle and dangerous. Keep your weapon close.
Have you tried your claw at the games? Rollicking good fun, don’t you think?I wonder if I could score a little higher if I tried again...
After all... it’s you that she wants... is it not?

Hoi! Magnificent! May our mighty contest of shells commence.But a final note, nimble bug! If ever you run off course or desire a quick convene, simply play what music you’re able and my companion shall whisk you back to our starting line.Now! The track calls us. Allow me a moment to assemble a course worthy to test our skill.

entry.name: SHERMA_RESCUE_MEET2
entry.hpage: Hold your gratitude, little one. The dead are stirring.

entry.name: SNAILS_ACT3_HORNET_MEMORY1
entry.hpage: It is time, shamans. I have the hearts, enough as requested. Enough to build your spell, yes?Aye. We’re ready. Still, it’s a sad set you’re holding there, strength such as few shall ever know... and all about to burn for Pharloom’s saving.I’ll warn ya, Old One, this first part might not be pleasant, but we’ll get you in there, deep as needed.Now you’ve only to ready yourself for what comes after. Lay up on the dais and we’ll begin.

entries.entry: Charting the heights of this great mount would prove a mighty challenge. For now, I have seen only its base.Once I have completed the search for my master, I would like to return and attempt the climb in full.
Worm-ridden caverns, shaking and unstable. There remain faint signs that pilgrims once travelled these tight paths.

Hooof... let us stop the duel there.I... hoof... I hope in my excitement I did not... hoof... bring down my lance too heavy upon you, sister.It was combat honourably conducted, sirs. But now, we should all of us keep moving. It will not remain quiet here for long.Y-yes, of course. Our good works are never done, and we must press ever on. There is no time to waste!
Don’t let defeat weigh on you, nimble bug! Simply step to the challenge. Let us soar swift together again!

entry.name: GARMOND_TALK1_CITADEL
entry.hpage: What cause saw you first ascend to this Citadel, Garmond?Mine is only the most sacred quest, sister! One shared with my most trusted companion, dear Zaza.We sought this Citadel, to stand before its rulers, and demand their answer! By force if necessary! All for our dear village to whom we pledge our shells. The fearsome haunting of thread, it overcame our fair folk.... We are all that remain, left to carry their memory, and the hope to see some justice paid.

entries.entry: Ahh, a fellow pilgrim. I’ve been praying alone here too long, with only the wind’s voice to join mine.We’re so close. Our pilgrimage is almost over. Just one final, brutal climb, hm?The Citadel is near, pilgrim. You must have had some strength in you. Few of your fellows seem to reach these heights.Aye, the roads become lonelier the longer they’re travelled and the higher we climb.It takes a lot of luck and a lot of faith to make it this far, though I’m sure I don’t need to tell you that.

Huu... You have done it... Huu. Huu... Hoof.Never would I have believed, a shell so fast in all of Pharloom! Wonder of wonders!You have proven it, nimble bug, fulfilled my wish, seen my pace matched and beaten, my limits broken wide.
Gurro! I have a notion for you, sister. What say we cross our weapons here before we move on? Engage in some rollicking combat together? Have no fear, I will not strike a mortal blow!

entry.name: GARMOND_FINAL
entry.hpage: Sir knight, I am sorry... This was the only means to free you from the cursed threads.Hohhhh... fret not.... little one...Be proud... you’ve grown so strong!Zaza... let us just rest a little... and then we’ll be away...

entries.entry: Nuu’s wish, it is granted. But miss grown-up will continue cutting creatures and adding them to our journal, of course?I will. Knowing a creature’s form and habits is an advantage that can decide the outcome of a battle. Recording these details is worth the effort.Oh yes! Is very much worth it! Nuu hopes you will share your new learnings with her often!And take a gift to help with your huntings, miss grown-up! Nuu will add a pocket to your tool pouch, for the bringing of many tools on your hunts!
Just a piece of a mask, innit? Don’t ask us where the other bits are... you’ll have to sniff ‘em out for yourself!
Mount Fay Map

entry.name: HUNTER_FAN_JOURNAL_COMPLETE_1
entry.hpage: Nuu, I have completed your request, recording many creatures of Pharloom in the journal.Oooh, ooh! Ma ma ma! Look here at the marvelous beasts and bugs, all listed so beautifully!Miss grown-up, so many creatures now you have cut and beat and smashed! Their essences linger on you, their scents mixing with your own!Oooh, ma... Nuu simply must sample it for herself!

entries.entry: You go on ahead. Zaza and I will keep guard here and catch any stragglers.

Nuu understands, ma. To sup on such a fierce predator’s juices would be divine... but is not right to do. Such behaviour is unfriendly.Nuu’s wish to see many fine beasts, though... miss grown-up, you have surely granted it! All of Nuu’s thanks goes to you!
I will soon leave these crumbling roads, but if you stop by the settlement below we may meet again. I pass there often to trade with the pilgrims.
Here, the trail of the stag touched pale... We hunted her, felled her, as none before were able...Proof it became, of our majesty... mark of our divine right...
Beautiful this, a glowy little piece of somethin’. Stinks of them horrid crawling whisperers a bit, so might be dangerous. You should take it! Give us your rosaries and lighten my claws of it!
Ho, sister! A grand victory achieved, again. The haunted might of this place cannot stand against our pure hearts!

entry.name: SNAILS_ACT3_DEEP_MEMORY4
entry.page: This task before you... This is mortal power you would claim, the hearts of bugs. It will cost their last strength to save this land.Even we have some hesitation in this. Despite our desire to touch their power, we’d never wished to see it expended so utterly.Better to leave your land weak in wonder, if it means your shells, and those of your fellows, stay intact.

entries.entry: Gurrrooooo! Gallantly answered, sister! Prepare your weapon!

Uaahhhhh! Miss grown-up... your journal is bursting with every sort of creature! Overflowing! Surely, we can call this complete!To think, that such a task could even be done! So clever is Nuu, to have set such a fierce predator onto the work!These vast lands hold so much life, and to catalogue it all has taught me greatly. It is an effort worth continuing even after I leave this kingdom.Ooh ma, such a hunger is worthy indeed! You and I are of accord, miss grown-up, hunters both. Our methods are different but our appetites have become very similar!Nuu has for you this token, a symbol of all your efforts, and a marker of your true nature. It carries with it her sweet, sweet smell!
All bowed before we princes green...

entry.name: GARMOND_TALK1
entry.hpage: What cause sees you travelling these blighted lands, Garmond? Do you also seek the Citadel above?Aye! But do not mistake a valorous adventurer for a mere pilgrim. Mine is a sacred quest, shared with my most trusted companion, dear Zaza.We seek that Citadel not for its gifts. Nay, sister! We seek its rulers, to demand their answer! By force if necessary! For our dear village to whom we pledge our shells. The fearsome haunting of thread, it overcame our fair folk... We are all that remain, left to carry their memory, and the hope to see some justice paid.

entry.name: MAPPER_GENERIC_CRAWL
entry.hpage: Greetings, Shakra. It was a welcome surprise to hear your call echo through these crumbling tunnels. How goes the search for your master?Poshanka! It is a difficult task to track anything in these caverns while the worms ceaselessly churn the rock.Still, I can see that my master has travelled here. Her path within this land winds strangely... I wonder at her intent.It is no matter though. She can enlighten me when again we meet. Until then, I will continue in her shadow.

entries.entry: Lockin’ us up in a place like this... what a shameful act!
Come now beast, let us hear your voice! Sing with me, sing with me, sing sing sing! Make caverns echo and great roads ring!
Very well, sister. Perhaps it is better that we all just rest here a little longer.

Nimble bug! You forfeited the race? It is true that sometimes a reset is needed, for the health of mind and shell.But what say you now? Surely you are eager to return to the track. Let us soar swift together again!
These black threads... they reach upwards with such a powerful longing. No wonder they can force themselves through even mighty stone!
Us snitchbugs can wriggle into any place we want, but with this key even a big oafy bug like you can get through a locked door!

entry.name: SNAILS_ACT3_HEART_HINT_ANT
entry.page: Through their march, at the far border of these lowlands, seek the last queen of the ant hunters. We can sense her still... just.In youth, her voice united the wild tribes. Gave them the strength to resist the pale monarch’s will... longer than most at least.

entries.entry: Let us head on, sister! Together we shall step forward under guidance of our faith!

Needle Child. Hakk! I encountered a settlement near here, at the core of a vein of old bells. The bugs there were snared silent on a web of Silk.It seemed the pernicious trap of some unseen predator. I left quickly, making sure to avoid the glimmering threads.I passed the town myself. The thread sickness, I’ve seen its like upon the roads, but there it does not discriminate.The curse that strikes the town, it is driven, focused. A cold use of Silk at a concerning scale.If the path permits, I will investigate its source.
What say you, nimble bug? Though no reward remains to give, I would delight to soar together with you again!
Snnnrk... Zaza... Snnnrnrrk... Look sharp my lad...

You haven’t enough rosaries for trading? The mad pilgrims in the overgrown village near here always carry some with them.Will you take what you need from them? Leaving them to wander their path endlessly is a false mercy.

Ho, what clever traps the red-shells lay out in defence of their lands!Impressive that you managed to survive such a brutal blow. Your shell must be mighty thick!Thick enough, though I’d rather have avoided the trap altogether.I’ll let it be a reminder to remain wary, even when no foes are nearby.
...Oh. Excuse me.
Well, what a pleasure. The road has carried you back to me.Care for a few games of dice, while we’re here? For the same wager, a beat of rosaries? Just sit here beside me and we’ll begin.
These docks, I thought them small when first I passed. Now I feel the structure’s true bulk hides below the molten lake.

The bellways, gilded veins that run throughout the lands. Supposedly, they were once used for travel?
These pins will mark stations on your map.

Again... to see... this land abandoned... betrayed......And a throne I could not sit alone...You were mortal bugs, caught beneath a being pale... Devotion or destruction... these are the only fates my kind allow.
The world has grown much dangerous, but still we must learn! Cut through the black threads, miss grown-up, and hunt down every beast of Pharloom!

entry.name: MAPPER_GENERIC_SHADOW
entry.hpage: Shakra, you too brave these bogs? The heights of Pharloom offer harsh welcome.So winds my master’s path, and so I follow. Yet true you speak! This is no place for me.That Citadel’s shadow falls heavy here. I can sense its horrid bulk besides.It is no surprise to see it choke these caverns dank and stagnant. That monstrosity of metal and stone cares not for the lands it consumes.

entries.entry: Quill
My master would have found her way to these wilds, I am sure. Her warrior’s sense has no equal. Surely, I must be drawing closer to her!
Leave us to our noble hunt, sister! The Citadel’s twisted bugs still infest these gilded halls. Many are their numbers, but we shall see their life’s thread severed.

You can use these to mark places of importance or reminders on your map.
The shell of the red-hunters makes for a vivid marker indeed.

How dank and fetid are these ancient roads, sister! My delicate whiskers are nearly overcome by the stench of evil in the air.Woe betide those with delicate senses, such as poor Zaza here. The shadow of that ghastly Citadel falls heavily upon this place!I’ve seen many mighty structures fall to decay in my time. Such places often become home to predators. Keep your sights trained on what lurks in the fog, sirs.
Hoy, you been creepin’ around this dusty old place for while then, eh? You must be carryin’ a lot of goodies with you! Let a poor old snitchfly ‘ave a quick look!

I’m Sherma, by the way. Just another humble pilgrim like yourself. If you ever need assistance on the road ahead, sing out my name and I’ll be sure to find you. Me and my lucky chime are at your service!
We ain’t leavin’ ‘til we’re done pilfering! You be off, if you’re so scared!
Please take some rosaries in exchange, red maiden!Though in these dark times their promise of holy reward may never be met, still they carry with them our fondest well-wishes.

Gate, gate, gate! Nicest gate I’ve met!
Gate, gate, gate! Greatest miracle yet! Ha ha ha!

entry.name: SNAILS_ACT3_MEET_END_NOTVISITED
entry.page: Those docks, atop the lake of flame, they still possess the means to pass below, though you’d be the first in an age to dare the descent.Then my path is clear. Remain in your sanctuary and await my return. If this land can be saved, you may have a part to play yet.

entries.entry: Race Sprintmaster Swift?
Ho, what clever traps the red-shells lay in defence of their lands!I’ve narrowly avoided a few nasty ends myself. It certainly adds a thrill to my investigations...

Well now! How brilliant! In all these fine games you have matched my scores and more!What wonder to be here, and able to witness a display of such profound talent.Besting your scores proved an immense challenge, Seth, and yet you seem to have achieved them yourself with relative ease.You flatter me! But yes, my own aptitude continues to surprise me. So many skills I cannot recall learning... But do not underplay your own achievements, for they too are significant, inspiring even!In fact, for my deep respect I insist you take this small medallion. I found it within my belongings, and know not where I came upon it, but it has a most pleasant sense.Let it serve as marker of a friendship I feel has only just begun.Thank you, Seth. I shall keep it close.

While we rest for the journey ahead, care to test your luck with a game of dice? You know how to play, I trust?I’m sure I can grasp the rules quickly enough, sir. What is the wager?A beat of rosaries on each roll. What say you? Sound fair? Let our worries roll away with the dice!

Hrm...? Oh, hoy there! ‘Tis a pleasure to meet you here at the end of our long journey, sister.I am Sherma, a simple pilgrim like yourself. What a wonder to find ourselves finally here, eh?Rising at last to the heights of the Citadel and being amongst so many of our brothers and sisters... it is a blessing indeed. Yes, a blessing.Your voice belies some hesitation in that belief, little pilgrim. To have travelled this far is to have seen the reality of this broken place. What do you make of it, truly?
Hoy! You again? This place used to be nice and quiet, but now we can’t get a moment’s peace!
Ahh, sister! You have awoken. I hope that our powerful strikes did not leave you in too weak a condition.We would even be willing to duel again, if you still have the strength!

entry.name: SETH_GREYMOOR_MEET
entry.hpage: Sir Guardian... I scarcely thought we would meet again after our encounter.Hm? Apologies friend, I fear I don’t recognise you. And I’m sure I would remember such a striking figure!...Pay no heed, sir. It seems I mistook you for another.You are... a traveller through these quaking lands, I take it?I suppose I am indeed! I was born into this world not long ago, waking beside a lake with only this weapon laying beside me.Seth is my name, though I know not who gave it to me.The custom of the newly-born is to explore the world, is it not? So that is what I have set out to do! I will rest here a moment, then continue my journey.

entries.entry: Miss grown-up! What sweet surprise for Nuu! The world rumbles and the black threads stretch. Not safe now to wander.But you! You are adult yes? Fully grown? Ready to hunt, no matter the darkness?Certainly I am no child, young one.Perfect then! Nuu must ask a wish! For her, you would seek Pharloom’s many fabulous bugs and cut them.Cut them with your blade! Cut them with your mature spirit! Cut them with your savage adult heart!Would you help Nuu? Before it all ends? Could you take her scroll, and fill its pages with the learnings of your cuts?

...Great strides move the world, but small steps shouldn’t be overlooked......One mystery leads to another. Scrutinising the belly of the thing will prove useful...The meaning behind your musings is as opaque as ever. Would you converse with me directly, sir?...Trust yourself. And each other. The solution is always within grasp...
The creatures of this wood can disguise themselves amongst the many branches. Watch for unexpected movement and be prepared to strike.
Spider dear, what a delight to have you visit! It is oh so lonely here at the bottom of the world.I cannot share your mirth, child. Your small rebellion above now causes this kingdom’s collapse.

entry.name: MAPPER_GENERIC_HUNTERSNEST_DEEP
entry.hpage: Greetings, Shakra. I had a sense I would find you in these winding tunnels, filled as they are with the marks of combat.Poshanka! You trust your instincts rightly. The red-shelled warriors who carved out these roads make for excellent opponents indeed.I would gladly spend much time here, testing myself against their blades and cunning traps, but I must keep to my task. As should you!

entries.entry: Hahhh... hahhh... oh, sister. What a toll it exacts on us... this endless combat! Certainly when peace finally comes, we will be in the right mind to appreciate it...You place too much burden upon yourself, sir.Though I share your ambition to free this land from its curse, I counsel you to rest, even if only for a short while.Us, rest? While you, my dear sister, fight on so gallantly? Hahhhh... we cannot.What would our old village think of us, were we to quit our charge? No, regardless of what you may believe, there’s strength enough still in these old shells!

entry.name: LACE_ABYSS_LAKE_DIVE_1
entry.hpage: Child, I hold the means to descend. Let us meet one final time, and quell this black ruin of our making.

entry.name: HUNTER_FAN_JOURNAL_GIVEN
entry.hpage: Learning about a land’s inhabitants is a worthwhile undertaking. Perhaps you are more grown than you realise, Nuu.Ma! Such delicious praise will make Nuu shrivel! Go now! Hunt, and prey, and begin our learning!

entries.entry: Child Wielding Needle. What do you make of this huge, groaning structure?The scale of it all impresses me. If this is merely an outpost of the Citadel above, then their capital must be grand beyond measure.Yokkala... Perhaps so. They must have prized indeed the work done here, to build something so vast in such a dangerous place.
Hunt Marker
Seek swift to calm our crying land, Hornet Wielding Needle. And know that I shall remain here, to stand against these husks gone dark.
I’ll bring the healing supplies to the settlement with all haste, red maiden.Fear not on my behalf. My fellow pilgrims are all praying for me, and thereby no harm will befall me!
‘Tis now my charge to care for those who stay here, including yourself. If I can aid you in any way, please let me know!
Oh, what a shock! Discovered again so easily! Like a hapless little hatchling!If you’re going to make a sport of tracking me, I’ll have to redouble my efforts at camouflage!
The jagged crest looming over all of Pharloom. Its whipping winds and bitter cold would pierce the strongest shell.
Ahh, the shining bench has risen for us! Pharloom’s kindness to we pilgrims is inexhaustible!Please rest, red maiden, and fear not. Our kingdom watches over us all!
Join your voice with mine, red maiden! You, me, and my lucky chime will sing together until the great gate opens!

Hrm? Hoy there! I was looking for somewhere to rest my weary shell and found this cosy station!These lands are dangerous. I had thought perhaps some harm had come to you.Harm? O red maiden, have faith! No harm can come to us on this holy ascent! We only need to keep our gaze upwards.Isn’t this all so terribly grand? The great stone steps, the winds lifting us up like the voices of a choir, and just beyond it all is our pilgrimage’s end. The great Citadel at last!

entry.name: SHERMA_CORAL_WAKE_1
entry.hpage: Little pilgrim, do you sleep?
